skillTree.localised_description: No hide nor armour can stand against the piercing fury of a Dryad or Tree Kin's savage limbs.

Armour-piercing weapon damage: +8 for Tree Kin units

skillTree.localised_description: Hewn from the same forest that surrounds them, Tree Kin withstand attacks like the forest withstands the fury of the seasons.

effects.description:
Ward save: 20% for Tree Kin units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The wild beasts of the forest always sense the emotions of the Treemen, empathising with their pain over eons of loss.

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

skillTree.localised_description: Those at forest fringes where the Wargrove is known to dwell gather anything but deadwood at their peril!

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +10 for Dryad, Tree Kin and Treeman units
	(Lord's army)
"Roused to Wrath" ability gains increased range, and the summoned Dryads no longer degrade

skillTree.localised_description: Many believe Drycha lost her mind when Morghurâ€™s blood was spilt amongst the roots of the once-glorious creature known as the Tree of Woe.
After years examining the Elvesâ€™ every action, the Briarmaven knows how to exploit their strengths as well as their weaknesses.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Melkoth's Mystifying Miasma"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Melkoth's Mystifying Miasma Upgraded"

Replaces the "Glamoured" passive ability with "Insidious Glamour" for all Elf units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The verdant labyrinth of the forest unsettles even the most courageous soul.

effects.description:
Hidden effect to grant Fear along with Terror
	(Lord's army)

Attribute: Causes Fear and Terror when ambushing in forests
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Ancientsâ€™ former handmaidens were once the forestâ€™s overseers, taming the Winds to bring sustenance to bough and branch â€“ that time will come again.
Many are the spirits Drycha believes have been failed by the Asrai, their names remembered by the enchantments of her unending mantra.

effects.description: Hidden effect that removes lvl 2 version of Roused to Wrath from the character

Enemy leadership: -8 for Elven units
	(enemy armies in local province)

Leadership: +6 for Dryads, Tree Kin and Treemen units
	(Lord's army)
"Roused to Wrath" ability gains an additional charge and infinite range

skillTree.localised_description: From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Taking their cue from the forest itself, the Lord endures and overcomes all.
Using the forest itself as a shield, this Lord is protected by their devotion to Athel Loren.
When to strike, when to block, when to dodge. These are all skills the warriors of Athel Loren must perfect.
There is no greater thrill than to be in the midst of battle, slaughtering in the forest's name.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
When everything else fails, there is always studying the blade. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
Wielding the shield is better than returning on it. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
The caster weaves a confounding fog that numbs and deludes enemies, causing them to stumble and stagger.

ui_effects.localised_text: Strong vs 25 men unit or above
Strong vs 25 men unit or above

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Melkoth's Mystifying Miasma"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Melkoth's Mystifying Miasma Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Melkoth's Mystifying Miasma Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: A conjured shadow is just as obfuscating as a real one - the Shadow Wizard is master or mistress of the 'concealing' arts.
When cast this spell enfeebles enemy minds; they feel the crushing weight of reality bearing down upon them.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "The Enfeebling Foe"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Enfeebling Foe Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Enfeebling Foe Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: The Wizard destroys their enemies from within, corroding foes' minds with doubt and crisis.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "The Withering"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Withering Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Withering Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: A spectral pendulum is summoned by the Wizard. On command, it swings, razor sharp and with lethal speed, through the foe.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Penumbral Pendulum"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "The Penumbral Pendulum Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Penumbral Pendulum Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: The spellcaster opens a vortex leading into the Pit. Anything caught within it will be lost forever.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Pit of Shades"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Pit of Shades Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: The supernatural solution is often the best; weapons materialise before the caster's allies, allowing them to slice through flesh, soul, and consciousness.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Okkam's Mindrazor"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Okkam's Mindrazor Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Okkam's Mindrazor Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Every blade and barbed branch will eventually find its mark â€“ when they do, the forestâ€™s infinite anger is truly felt.

skillTree.localised_description: Moving like the wind, whistling past tree branches, the riders of the forest hunt any who would do harm to the place they call home.

skillTree.localised_description: All of Athel Loren shouts with a fury as old as the ages, and the enemy knows its power.

skillTree.localised_description: The denizens of the forest will travel many miles to see those who would threaten Athel Loren put to rout.
Athel Loren provides for its deserving children, with wondrous boons gifted in recognition of their many endeavours.
The Worldroots provide succour for their children, purging the forests of any corrupting infestation.
The magics of the woods obscure and connive, able to turn enemy blades away from their targets.
The forest provides for its warriors, rehabilitating and regenerating wounds suffered in its defence.
From all corners of the forest, they come to defend their homes.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: The dead do not want for material possessions, yet the living may yet find value in themâ€¦

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +5%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +10%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: Like the forest itself, the warriors of Athel Loren ebb and flow and regenerate with the passing of time.
A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
The forest-dwellers draw from the strength of Kurnous to fight ever harder, and be ever stronger.
